intro: Lachemilla bourgeaui, commonly known as the golden mossy cushion, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the Andes Mountains. It belongs to the family Rosaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, rounded leaves that are typically covered in a fine layer of white to silver hairs. Its flowers are usually pink or white, appearing in clusters at the ends of the stems. Lachemilla bourgeaui thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine or subalpine regions.
